param.name: description
param.value: A general-purpose analysis workflow for whole-genome or targeted resequencing. Reads are passed through a filtering stage, mapped to a provided reference sequence, and consensus and variants are identified versus this reference.

module.label: BLASR v1
module.description: BLASR maps reads to genomes by finding the highest scoring local alignment or set of local alignments between the read and the genome. The first set of alignments is found by querying an index of the reference genome, and then refining until only high scoring alignments are retained. The base assignment in alignments is optimized and scored using all available quality information, such as insertion and deletion quality values.

param.name: maxHits
param.label: Maximum number of hits per read
param.title: The maximum number of matches of each read to the reference sequence that will be evaluated.

rule.message: Value must be an integer between 0 and 1000

param.name: maxDivergence
param.label: Maximum divergence (%)
param.title: The maximum allowed divergence of a read from the reference sequence.

rule.message: Value must be an integer between 0 and 100

param.name: minAnchorSize
param.label: Minimum anchor size
param.title: The minimum anchor size defines the length of the read that must match against the reference sequence.

rule.message: Value must be an integer between 8 and 30

param.name: samBam
param.label: Write output as a BAM file
